abstract: Second report released by international panel examining 2014 case of 43 Mexican college students that disappeared in Iguala, Mexico, challenges authorities conclusion that students were murdered and incinerated by drug gang; panel suggests Mexican officials violated international investigative protocols.

headline.print_headline: Jousting With Mexican Officials Marked Close of Inquiry on Missing Students
headline.main: Inquiry Into Missing Mexican Students Ends on Note of Frustration

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Foreign investigators and the government battled each other with dueling news conferences in the inquiry’s final week.
lead_paragraph: Foreign investigators and the government battled each other with dueling news conferences in the inquiry’s final week.
